oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1940-03-02 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from March 2, 1940. Featuring David Stone (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Uncle Dave Macon and son Dorris Macon, Ford Rush, Jack Shook and the Missouri Mountaineers, Napoleon 'Nap' Bastien, and Dee Simmons. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Jack Shook; Napoleon 'Nap' Bastien; Dee Simmons; Uncle Dave Macon; Dorris Macon; Ford Rush
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Poultry commercial (excerpt) -- Running Wild (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) [continued from part 1] -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone) -- George D. Hay introduces Jack, Nap and Dee -- Cool Water (Jack Shook, Nap Bastien, Dee Simmons) -- George D. Hay introduces Uncle Dave Macon and Dorris Macon -- All Go Hungry Hash House (Uncle Dave Macon, Dorris Macon) -- George D. Hay introduces Ford Rush -- Swallowtail Coat (Ford Rush) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Give The Fiddler A Dram (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone) -- Closing theme (Raven's Gap) -- Closing statement (George D. Hay) -- Closing statement (David Stone)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Hay, George D.
